description: A port on which traffic is allowed

endPort.description: If set, indicates that the range of ports from `port` to `endPort`, inclusive, should be allowed by the policy. This field cannot be defined if the `port` field is not defined or if the `port` field is defined as a named (string) port. The `endPort` must be equal or greater than `port`. This feature is in Beta state and should be enabled using the feature  gate `NetworkPolicyEndPort`.

port.description: The port on the given protocol. This can either be a numerical or named port on a Pod. The port number must be between 1 and 65535, if specified. If it is a port name, the name string subject to validation. If this field is not provided, this matches all port names and numbers. If present, only traffic on the specified `protocol` AND `port` will be matched.

protocol.description: The protocol which traffic must match.
